item.title: High-Dimensional Probability
item.description: This file is for the notes and exercises for the book High-Dimensional Probability Errata and update of the book: errata, update. Exercises solns reference: soln. 0. Appetizer Key Takeaways convex combination $\sum^{m}{i=1}\lambda_i z_i$ where $\lambda_i\ge 0$ and $\sum^{m}{i=1}\lambda_i=1$. convex hull of a set $T$, $\mathrm{conv}(T)={\text{convex combinations of }z_1,\cdots,z_m\in T\text{ for }m\in \mathbb{N}}$. Theorem 0.0.1 (Caratheodory’s Theorem): Every point in the convex hull of a set $T\subseteq \mathbb{R}^n$ can be expressed as a convex combination of at most $n+1$ points from $T$.
